projects.title: Skibox Design & Development
projects.description:
CLIENT: VDL Bus Modules BV, Valkenswaard, The Netherlands

CAD/PLM TOOLS USED: Creo Parametric 3.0, Windchill 10.3

Project Overview:
- Obtaining the A-surface styling data and checking for further boundary conditions.
- Checking and developing feasible structure and internal components for the product, considering the loading condition and ensuring cost reduction for materials and bonding techniques (DFA).
- Major criteria here was the time duration and completely finished products were expected in limited time; had to ensure the right communication and set targets, considering all the suppliers/design team across different locations.
- Leading a team of 3 engineers at offshore, regular checking with the supplier communications (plastic and construction); thus providing the design solutions and maintained design reports and approval log from the chief engineer.
- Creating the final design changes, releasing the assembly configurations in the PLM system and production drawing quality check were involved.

projects.title: Development of New Variant Double-deck Bus Sections
projects.description:
CLIENT: VDL Bus Modules BV, Valkenswaard, The Netherlands

CAD/PLM TOOLS USED: Creo Parametric 2.0, Windchill 10.2, AutoCAD 2015

PROJECT OVERVIEW:
- As per customer specification, design considerations were amended on various sections of the bus (chassis middle structure, side-walls, front interior plastics, overhead luggage racks, intermediate sandwich floor, etc.)
- Interactions with validation engineers, purchase team and homologation team were involved, to decide upon the program progress and developments.
- Ensured the effective design, conducted peer QC/design review for all the assigned development work.
- Supported the homologation activities for the latest design changes, following the ECWVTA norms.
- New ‘type approval’ detailing were derived, some of which included the horn positioning, mirror homologation, fuel-tank placement, fire extinguisher/glass break hammer layout and staircase/gangway test gauge allowance.

projects.title: Air-co Piping Layout for the New Inter-deck Coaches
projects.description:
CLIENT: Plaxton Ltd., Scarborough, UK (A unit of Alexander Dennis Ltd., UK)

CAD/PLM TOOLS USED: CATIA V5 R19, SmarTeam V5

PROJECT OVERVIEW:
- Developing the complete air-co piping layout for the new coach, including the clamping arrangement and different pipe materials at various regions.
- Selection and creation of copper-pipe parts, plastic PVC pipes and silicon hoses along the chassis area, including the positioning and fitment provisions.
- The convector unit lengths and layouts were also devised, thus consulting with the production manager for easy and efficient assembly of the components, at the shop floor.
- Complete assembly design, extensive detailing and standardisation of parts were addressed.
